item.title: Bow of tree outside private property is on verge of falling down, 15th July
item.description:
This issue has been reported this evening (15 July 2025) as an emergency situation. This fixmy street report is to record the evidence of the issue, in case the tree should subsequently fall down. If it should fall down, there is risk of danger to life, and / or damage to private property. This tree has been reported as overgrown, and in need of management, over a number of recent years. To date, no action has been taken by Bromley Council. I politely request that this tree is immediately felled in a controlled manner, before it falls down of its own accord, the consequences are obvious. My hope is that your Emergency team deals with this matter with the upmost urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downs Hill, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 15th July

item.title: Abandoned vehicle being used as fly tipping, 15th July
item.description:
This van has not moved for over six months and is being used to dump rubbish in, so much so that it is now overflowing onto the pavement and road. It is swarming with flies and rats have also been seen around it. Government website shows the vehicles MOT expired in October 2024. Van is parked outside 17 Minard Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Minard Road, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enfield council web site untrue, 15th July
item.description:
Residential roads are cleansed once a week (Monday to Friday). Shopping areas are cleansed daily, including weekends.- this is from the site. Prince George’s Avenue/ chaseville road has not been cleaned in five weeks. Chaseville is a shopping area and prince George’s Avenue residential. The site also states - I Fly-tipping on council land There are numerous teams working throughout the day, both proactively and reactively, to clear waste on publicly owned roads and paths.. Yet the fly tips on hoppers road bu the only bin happen in broad daylight .. This fly tip is two days in. The other bin in eversely park road is just never emptied until complaints are made.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downes Court, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
